stimulusHtml: Evaluate  ∫ 0 3 A ′ ( t )dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F70@ . Using appropriate units, interpret the meaning of that integral in terms of cross-sectional area.

features.html:
At a certain height, a tree trunk has a circular cross section. The radius R(t) of that cross section grows at a rate modeled by the function

dR dt = 1 16 ( 3+sin( t 2 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4760@  centimeters per year for

0 ≤ t ≤ 3 , where time t is measured in years. At time t = 0, the radius is 6 centimeters. The area of the cross section at time t is denoted by A(t).
